title: gRPC Endpoints
body_html:
Overview

Work in Progress

This document is an work in progress. Details may be missing or incomplete and are subject to change.

The endpoints described on this page provide access to information from Dash Platform (layer 2) as well as streaming of events related to blocks and transactions/transitions.

Connecting to gRPC

The examples below use a command-line tool named gRPCurl that allows interacting with gRPC servers in a similar way as curl does for the JSON-RPCs. Additional information may be found in the gRPC documentation.

Data Encoding

gRPC Response Format

The information returned is CBOR encoded. Libraries such as cbor (JavaScript) and cbor2 (Python) can be used to encode/decode data for DAPI gRPC endpoints.

  • Python
import cbor2
identity = 'o2JpZHgsQ2JZVnlvS25HeGtIYUJydWNDQWhQRUJjcHV6OGoxNWNuWVlpdjFDRUhCTnhkdHlwZQFqcHVibGljS2V5c4GkYmlkAWRkYXRheCxBbXpSMkZNNGZZd0NtWnhHWjFOMnRhMkZmdUo5NU93K0xMQXJaREx1WUJqdGR0eXBlAWlpc0VuYWJsZWT1'

print('Identity details: {}\n'.format(cbor2.loads(identity)))

Endpoint Details - Platform

applyStateTransition

Returns: Nothing or error
Parameters:

Name Type Required Description
state_transition Bytes (Base-64) Yes A state transition

Example Request and Response

  • Request (gRPCurl)
# Submit a DPNS `preorder` State Transition
grpcurl -proto protos/platform.proto -plaintext \
  -d '{
    "state_transition":""

    }' \
  evonet.thephez.com:3010 \
  org.dash.platform.dapi.v0.Platform/getIdentity

Response: No response except on error

getIdentity

Returns: Identity information for the requested identity
Parameters:

Name Type Required Description
id String Yes An identity id

Example Request and Response

  • Request (gRPCurl)
grpcurl -proto protos/platform.proto -plaintext \
  -d '{
    "id":"CbYVyoKnGxkHaBrucCAhPEBcpuz8j15cnYYiv1CEHBNx"
    }' \
  evonet.thephez.com:3010 \
  org.dash.platform.dapi.v0.Platform/getIdentity
  • Response (truncated)
{
  "identity": "o2JpZHgsQ2JZVnlvS25HeGtIYUJydWNDQWhQRUJjcHV6OGoxNWNuWVlpdjFDRUhCTnhkdHlwZQFqcHVibGljS2V5c4GkYmlkAWRkYXRheCxBbXpSMkZNNGZZd0NtWnhHWjFOMnRhMkZmdUo5NU93K0xMQXJaREx1WUJqdGR0eXBlAWlpc0VuYWJsZWT1"
}

getDataContract

Returns: Data Contract information for the requested data contract
Parameters:

Name Type Required Description
id String Yes A data contract id

Example Request and Response

  • Request (gRPCurl)
grpcurl -proto protos/platform.proto -plaintext \
  -d '{
    "id":"2KfMcMxktKimJxAZUeZwYkFUsEcAZhDKEpQs8GMnpUse"
    }' \
  evonet.thephez.com:3010 \
  org.dash.platform.dapi.v0.Platform/getDataContract
  • Response
{
  "dataContract": ""
}

getDocuments

Returns: Document information for the requested document(s)
Parameters:

Name Type Required Description
data_contract_id String Yes A data contract id
document_type String Yes A document type defined by the data contract (e.g. preorder or domain for the DPNS contract)
where * String No Where clause to filter the results (must be CBOR encoded)
order_by * String No Sort records by the field(s) provided (must be CBOR encoded)
limit * String No Maximum number of results to return
----------
One of the following:
start_at * String No Return records beginning with the index provided
start_after * String No Return records beginning after the index provided

* Parameter constraints

The where, order_by, limit, start_at, and start_after parameters must comply with the limits defined on the Query Syntax page.

Additionally, note that where and order_by must be CBOR encoded.

Example Request and Response

  • Shell
grpcurl -proto protos/platform.proto -plaintext \
  -d '{
    "data_contract_id":"2KfMcMxktKimJxAZUeZwYkFUsEcAZhDKEpQs8GMnpUse",
    "document_type":"domain",
    "limit":1
    }' \
  evonet.thephez.com:3010 \
  org.dash.platform.dapi.v0.Platform/getDocuments
  • JSON
{
  "documents": [
    ""
  ]
}

Endpoint Details - Transaction Filter Stream

Endpoint Details - Core

Code Reference

Implementation details related to the information on this page can be found in:

  • The DAPI repository's lib/rpcServer/commands/platform folder
  • The DAPI-gRPC repository (particularly the protos folder which defines the gRPC requests/responses)
